title: Bênçãos Que Não Têm Fim (Counting My Blessings)
licensing_note: Lyrics via Musixmatch API; translations via Google Translate API; grammar notes auto-generated placeholders.

lines.text: Ainda me lembro quando um milagre eu pedi
lines.translation: I still remember when I asked for a miracle.
lines.grammar: Portuguese note: Verb focus: quando (check person/tense and prefixes). Contractions with articles; clitic pronouns may attach; nasal endings common. Meaning: 'I still remember when I asked for a miracle.'. Highlight any set phrase to memorize and how the verb agrees with the subject.

lines.text: Com pouca fé, sim, eu temi
lines.translation: With little faith, yes, I was afraid.
lines.grammar: Portuguese note: Identify the main verb, its ending, and any prefix movement. Contractions with articles; clitic pronouns may attach; nasal endings common. Meaning: 'With little faith, yes, I was afraid.'. Highlight any set phrase to memorize and how the verb agrees with the subject.

lines.text: E hoje eu posso ver, foi muito além do meu pensar
lines.translation: And today I can see, it went far beyond what I had imagined.
lines.grammar: Portuguese note: Verb focus: pensar (check person/tense and prefixes). Contractions with articles; clitic pronouns may attach; nasal endings common. Meaning: 'And today I can see, it went far beyond what I had imagined.'. Highlight any set phrase to memorize and how the verb agrees with the subject.

lines.translation: There are so many blessings to recount.
lines.grammar: Portuguese note: Verb focus: contar (check person/tense and prefixes). Contractions with articles; clitic pronouns may attach; nasal endings common. Meaning: 'There are so many blessings to recount.'. Highlight any set phrase to memorize and how the verb agrees with the subject.

lines.text: E nenhuma fase dura para sempre
lines.grammar: Portuguese note: Identify the main verb, its ending, and any prefix movement. Contractions with articles; clitic pronouns may attach; nasal endings common. Meaning: 'And no phase lasts forever.'. Highlight any set phrase to memorize and how the verb agrees with the subject.

lines.text: Por isso, eu não vou me esquecer
lines.grammar: Portuguese note: Verb focus: esquecer (check person/tense and prefixes). Contractions with articles; clitic pronouns may attach; nasal endings common. Meaning: 'That's why I won't forget.'. Highlight any set phrase to memorize and how the verb agrees with the subject.
